resources.string: Tasker Health Connect
Grant Permissions
Permissions are granted and Health Connect is available. Open Tasker, and look for Tasker Health Connect inside Action -> Plugins
Not all permissions have been granted, open the Health Connect app to grant permissions
Health connect is not installed or is unavailable, check for updates
Health Connect is unavailable or permissions are not granted
Install Health Connect
Failed to open Health Connect installation page
Debug
Done
Class of the type of Health Record
The Class Name of the type of Health Record. This must be a valid class from androidx.health.connect.client.records.* package, e.g. StepsRecord. Supports Tasker Variables.
Start Timestamp
The timestamp (in epoch milliseconds) to start fetching records from. Supports Tasker Variables like %TIMEMS.
End Timestamp
The timestamp (in epoch milliseconds) to stop fetching records from. Supports Tasker Variables like %TIMEMS.
Read Aggregated Data
Data will be returned as a JSON object, see HealthConnectClient.aggregate API for the response format.
Write Data
Read Data
Data will be returned as a JSON object, see HealthConnectClient.readRecords API for the response format.
Write Data Response
Data will be returned as a JSON object, see HealthConnectClient.insertRecords API for the response format.
JSON Object or List of Objects to write
Version %s
Check for updates
Aggregate Metric Class.Field
The Aggregate Metric to return from androidx.health.connect.client.records.* package, must be in the format ClassName.FieldName, e.g. StepsRecord.COUNT_TOTAL
